https://t.co/0HKWvLZBGE
https://t.co/BWx58xiArb
https://t.co/bEkLXefyXH
https://t.co/cVzJsZIFO9 #poetry

Background Noise

Parts of the background blur-
marginalize and compartmentalize

Listen 

I stand here screaming in the dark – 
in your ear

Don’t you hear me? 

As you turn away, 
ears closed

I am background noise
I am background noise
I am background noise
I am background noise

I am background noise
I am background noise
I am background noise
I am background noise
I am background noise

As I bend and sway to your rules, 
letting stuff out, 
as well as letting things in.

Background noise 
in people's lives –

not important enough 
to actually listen 
- to shape one's life around. 

I am background noise

I’m the one 
who shapes my life 
to fit the needs
love can live in.

I am background noise
I am background noise
I am background noise

This #poem was "Background Noise"

Do YOU love #Poetry? Enjoy my #Poem iWant from my latest #book.

iWant

iNeed to know what's up -
what's going on? https://t.co/jQduy4HSqw

iHave to feed my addiction

iPhone injected
into my central
nervous system

iFeel the vibrating
pulsating alert

iStrap on
turn on
put it in me

iBoot up
background noise
masquerading as
more

iNformation

~ Jerry Danielsen

Do YOU Like #Poetry, #Film & #Music? Then check out this #multimedia #presentation of my #poem The Little Chair ~ JD https://t.co/R8d7xhediY

The Little Chair. 
From Background Noise By Jerry Danielsen

The Little Chair
Held up a man
who spoke to himself
as he typed
into a computer

And the little wooden chair
didn't know about
circuitry
or words
or Starbucks

And she wondered
why these things
are more important
than her mother tree

Just so a man
can sit on her
while talking to himself
bewildered

 ~ Jerry Danielsen

My short poem Now Little Johnny And Sue ~ JD https://t.co/W4WQ98uvh5
https://t.co/BWx58xiArb https://t.co/bEkLXefyXH https://t.co/M6SBQXBsld

"Now Little Johnny And Sue."

Stay away from it.
It’s bad for you and causes problems.
It’s sick and corrupt.

After repeated exposure
you won’t be able to concentrate
on anything for over
a minute and a half,

even after watching music videos.
Dare to say no to pop culture.

~ Jerry Danielsen

My poem SALT AND CHOCOLATE from my book BACKGROUND NOISE - now @/On Kindle!
Full Poem & Story https://t.co/fkW9C5GJM5 http://t.co/o0LgChFabQ

"Salt and Chocolate." 
 
She said she loved me

Not like chocolate
but like BBQ potato chips

She liked the crisp snap
the salt

but the depth wasn't there

She misread the ingredients
and treated me so lightly
like the little empty bag
with some crumbs in the bottom

My bitter sweet dark milk chocolate soul
was missed
the sugar
ignored

Not that I don't like chips

But the big hunger
kept burning

The big hunger
kept me hollow

And she couldn't digest
the words from my mouth
that left her tongue tied

like the bite taken
out of an empty chocolate figure -
with salt
in it's wounds

~ Jerry Danielsen

My #poem AGAINST THE FOG from my latest book of #poetry: BACKGROUND NOISE!
Full Poem & Story: https://t.co/j6axxhMqHm http://t.co/NCQt32plV4

Against The Fog       
  
In the rain -
Yawning ominous street lights
flash flood my eyes
and I dig deep for reasons
why I let myself down.

The gutters run with water
the old familiar asphalt screams aloud -
a mouth trying to swallow me.

I fall against the fog
and search for lost paths -
a street sign pointing
a different direction
that I missed the first time.

Tracing trails of longing,
arriving with a hollow band-aid
around my empty smiling soul -
enveloped in sunny shadows
and buried hunger.

I starve my thirsty imagination
and imagine my starving thirst,
flying over my shadow
on lakes of clouds
and pioneering pages of promise.

Yell aloud as the world passes by
Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!! 

I drip effortlessly on the floor   
of sanity and glazed perception.

The sand foams under crashing
waves of bent guitar strings
singing loud and
splashing on birds
hovering gently
on streams of jets.

I talk to my pillow and
turn sheets
of paper thin ideas -
fragile and creased,
they float up
against the fog.

~ Jerry Danielsen

You can NOW read my poem "Modern Cavemen" in it's complete, proper poetic format entirety @  https://t.co/zVbiAn6OHR http://t.co/BCLOq4xzXJ

"Modern Cavemen"

Isn’t it great that we are sophisticated?

We have paint cans to apply our superstitious graffiti

Instead of having to chisel and hammer on stone walls
Like our primitive ancestors did.

We are so above those savage cave people -

We have guns to pierce our ears instead of using bones -

And we have chemically treated paint
to go on our faces instead of clay and mud.

We’re so advanced, we also have psychologists, psychiatrists
and sociologists to unravel the complex net of advanced problems we have.

Aren’t we lucky?

We have other people butcher our meat for us
To keep us from being so animal-like.

We shave the hair off of our mammalian bodies
to prove we are modern.

When our tribes fight each other we can press buttons

to do it the clean way.

The miracles of science have enabled us
to last longer and live faster.

Sometimes, I have a couple of extra hours a week
To do nothing, but sit and worry about wasted time.

Those backward cave people didn’t accomplish anything,
Just sleeping and hunting and eating – in tune with nature.

They didn’t even have a way to tell time.

I bet my children are going to be happier than that.

~ Jerry Danielsen http://t.co/7XKVnnFuRK

My #poem INTRASTELLAR FREEWAYS can be read in it's entirety @ https://t.co/b3HIYNP0RO
http://t.co/BWx58xiArb #poetry http://t.co/fXvxdwGvLv

"Intrastellar Freeways."
 
We throw our voice,
Gazing across the glazed asphalt.
 
Rules intimidate resistance,
Trees explode in anger,

Greed foreshadows ozone gaps,
Careless chanting for more.
Grasping for rain dances,
Replaced by our jobs.
Energy contained by accepting

The nightmare of systematic persuasion.
Clouds spontaneously combust.
 
It works.
We can survive by turning off our senses.
It works.

Have I said enough?
I don't think so -
 
The continuum flickers
As we throw a sheath of fantasy
Around our cocoon of restriction.

Torn between personalities,
We throw our voices away
& quote cliché phrases
That penetrate D.N.A.,
Plant in the primordial ooze,

& form into our own words,
Manipulating race memory.
 
I used to have my own ideas,
Then I found out
What everyone else believes is better.

But I digress.

~ By Jerry Danielsen

Love #Poetry? Read along w/ the short #film #video experience of my #poem MARKETING TO DEATH! https://t.co/iFC4yeiGPh http://t.co/h8cTVtODvc

Love #Poetry?

“Marketing To Death.”
~ By Jerry Danielsen

You can have it all,
Obsession, insanity
 
Get rich instantly
And without effort

Pushed hard from
The shards of expectation
 
Dining with madness
Eat everything
All the time
 
Then make us thin

With a barrage of obstacles
Society is our friend
We trust in its tricks
While it lies and distorts
 
It’s adulterous nature
Is untreatable

We believe in information
And things –
 
Whatever is beautiful to you –
You’ll be that
 
Wherever is better –
You’ll be there

Bigger and better
 
It’s all good at
http://t.co/M5nRv0MPpC
 
Click here to find
More places to click on
And get a chance

For the possibility
Of more clicking
Point and click
Pointlessly clicking
Until the point
Is clicking
 
Destinationless

Impersonal, personal relations
Self–absorbed human resources
 
We care about you –
We’d love to
Place our product
In your home

With your family

You’ll look better
Right away –
No matter what
 
Even though the side effects
Are worse than the problem

It’s Chemist and Doctor approved
We guarantee
You’ll no longer
Do anything for yourself
But you’ll think you are

There’ll be no
Immediate obvious
Superficial problems
Unless you look deep
Into the mirror

And notice the painful
Residue of unsightly
Spiritual decay
 
Come and get it now!

~  Jerry Danielsen

You can NOW read my #poem "BLISTER" in it's entirety & proper #poetic format @ https://t.co/kmYsFaBr3G #poetry #poet http://t.co/KiSzMWiPnL

My #Poem Titled - "Blister"
 
time is what I need to take
 
to lay backward
        and pray
 
count my breath
        and rotate in
the sky

with the stars

between light years
        of hope

on the wind
        the leaves
or the petals
        of a daisy

crisp as morning fog
        and blue as miles long
 
shoes off
        the grass cries for toes
wet with dew and promise

green with warmth
        red with calm
 
I blister...

~ Jerry Danielsen

Parts of the background blur-
marginalize and compartmentalize.

Listen 

I stand here screaming in the dark – 
in your ear.

Don’t you hear me? 

As you turn away, 
ears closed

I am background noise
I am background noise
I am background noise ...

I am background noise
I am background noise ...

As I bend and sway to your rules, 
letting stuff out, 
as well as letting things in.

Background noise 
in people's lives –

not important enough 
to actually listen 
- to shape one's life around. 

I am background noise

I’m the one 
who shapes my life 
to fit the needs
love can live in.

I am background noise
I am background noise ...

~ Jerry Danielsen

Read my #poem "Ode To Songs That Were Never Written" in its complete, poetic format @
https://t.co/2IYjdhBiLe #poetry http://t.co/fjLZMbkJNs

"Ode To Songs That Were Never Written." 
 
Going uncelebrated
Great music
The best words
Were never written

Because we’re too busy

To rejoice in the whispering
Echoes of what might be

Unaware know-it-alls
Nitpicking through our persnickety lives
Distracted
Drifting

Naive
Aimless
Illusion of desire

Not knowing what we don’t know
We can’t hear
The song that wasn’t written
But it’s there
Under the surface

Waiting –

It’s joined by unwritten words
Multitudes of them
Songs and words
A symphony of silence

And I’m asking you
Here and now
To try to listen
To my imagination
And the grief I feel

For the potential
Of what could have been written
And the notes that might resonate
Somewhere
 
~ Jerry Danielsen

My LA #concert, #poetry #film screening & public talk on Following Our Passion: Sun 7-26
INFO https://t.co/mctGEMVfSR http://t.co/iMgnsqz3Yc

My #poem & #film MARKETING TO DEATH

You can have it all
Obsession, insanity
 
Get rich instantly
And without effort
https://t.co/2uSPFIWmth

Pushed hard from
The shards of expectation
 
Dining with madness
Eat everything
All the time
 
Then make us thin

With a barrage of obstacles
Society is our friend
We trust in its tricks
While it lies and distorts
 
It’s adulterous nature
Is untreatable

We believe in information
And things –
 
Whatever is beautiful to you –
You’ll be that
 
Wherever is better –
You’ll be there

Bigger and better
 
It’s all good @
http://t.co/M5nRv0MPpC
 
Click here to find
More places to click on
And get a chance
For the possibility

Of more clicking
Point and click
Pointlessly clicking
Until the point
Is clicking
 
Destinationless

Impersonal, personal relations

Self–absorbed human resources
 
We care about you –
We’d love to
Place our product
In your home
With your family

You’ll look better

Right away –
No matter what
 
Even though the side effects
Are worse than the problem
 
It’s Chemist and Doctor approved
We guarantee

You’ll no longer
Do anything for yourself
But you’ll think you are
 
There’ll be no
Immediate obvious
Superficial problems

Unless you look deep
Into the mirror
And notice the painful
Residue of unsightly
Spiritual decay
 
Come and get it now!

~ Jerry Danielsen
